@rubenssoto Closing this ticket due to inactivity. Please re-open if you need further assistance.
@n3nash @konradwudkowski  https://github.com/apache/hudi/pull/3066 pls review if this note looks good

An update here:
For the first issue, I changed the class to MultiPartKeysValueExtractor and tested it on the EMR cluster. It works as expected. Both hive and hudi reads and showing the right data. I however see the same exception with GlobalDeleteKeyGenerator.

Please take a look and update the hudi doc with the right KeyGenerator for hard delete usecase.

I was able to get around the 2nd issue by creating the hive db with location information:
spark.sql("""CREATE DATABASE test_hudi_db LOCATION "s3://bucket/pranoti/hudi/datasets/test1/test_hudi_db"""") 

I was able to save the non-partitioned table in this DB after this. May be some changes are needed in the code. My metastore is Glue.
@veenaypatil looks good to me, thanks!

closing this.

If we don't want to impact the memory footprint of `HoodieRecord`,  we have two options:

1. We could convert the value from `timestamp` to `long` when setting `orderingVal` at all places.
2. We do not represent `timestamp` based `LogicalTypes` as `LocalDateTime`.

@nsivabalan Any suggestions on which approach should we go ahead with?

@tandonraghav To expect the payload semantics for compaction, you need to override the `preCombine` implementation and have the same implementation across `combineAndGetUpdateValue` and `preCombine`. The idea is that whether it is 2 records in memory, 2 records on disk or 1 record in memory vs 1 on disk -> we call either `preCombine` or `combineAndGetUpdateValue` depending on what can be constructed as a payload. 

Please try overriding preCombine and let me know if you still see problems. We might open a documentation around this to make it more clear.
